title: Anniston Police say shooting case involving 11-year-old illustrates need for gun safety
content:
ANNISTON, Alabama -- Anniston Police released details of a case today involving an 11-year-old accidental shooting victim.
Capt. Allen George said the incident happened July 9 at a home in the 3900 block of Greenbrier Dear Road between 12:45 and 12:50 p.m.
The juvenile is a resident of Chicago who was visiting Anniston for the summer, George said. He told police he discovered a handgun an older teen relative had concealed among bushes at the home.
When the relative discovered the victim with the gun, the two struggled, causing the victim to pull away and the gun to fire, George said.
A .25 caliber bullet struck the victim in the right side and exited through his left lower chest. The victim was transported to Northeast Alabama Regional Medical Center and then flown to UAB for further treatment.
George said the victim returned to Chicago today with his mother and is expected to make a full recovery.
"This case highlights the importance of responsible gun ownership," George said. "Responsible gun ownership reduces the theft of firearms and accidental shootings of this nature."
